snippet: Henry Ford recognized that business succeeds when workers do.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Hedrick Smith, the former Washington bureau chief of The New York Times, observes that corporate executives used to believe that higher wages for workers were good for business during America's post-World War II period of sustained growth; contrasts that with the prevailing corporate wisdom; contends that history has shown that if the middle class is given a better share of the nation's economic gains, the economy will grow faster.
lead_paragraph: Henry Ford recognized that business succeeds when workers do.
